title: Chicken and mushroom risotto
summary: A creamy and comforting one pot meal, perfect winter warmer for those chilly nights!
author: Umami
ingredients: 300g risotto rice, 2 chicken breasts, 150g mushrooms, 1 litre chicken stock, 100ml white wine, 1 onion, 30g butter, 2 bacon rashers, parsley, parmesan
recipe_instruction:
1. Chop the onions and cut the chicken into small bite sized pieces.
  2. In a large pan, melt the butter and stir in the bacon and onions. Once the onions have softened, add the chicken and cook until golden brown.
  3. Add the mushrooms and rice and stir so all the rice is covered in the butter and has started to change colour.
  4. Pour in the wine and add the chicken stock, a bit at a time, allowing the stock to be absorbed by the rice, but not letting it burn.
  5. Gently simmer until the rice has cooked through, adding more stock if needed, and it has a lovely creamy texture.
  6. Remove from the heat and stir through some parmesan and parsley, season with salt and pepper to taste and serve.

title: Stir fry noodles
summary: A fantastically quick mid-week meal, whether you want a veggie option by leaving out the chicken or a super easy version using ready cut veg, this tasty dish can be ready in minutes!
author: Umami
ingredients: 2 nest or approx 150g egg noodles, 2 chicken breasts or thighs, 1 glove of garlic, 1 small piece of ginger, A couple of spring onions, 1 yellow or chilli pepper (depending on taste), 1 carrot, 20g of cashew nuts, 2 tablespoons soy sauce
recipe_instruction:
1. Finely chop the garlic and ginger, chop the spring onions and pepper, and slice the carrot into strips. Slice the chicken into small strips.
  2. Cook the noodles as per the instructions on the pack (or use ready cooked noodles).
  3. Whilst the noodles are cooking, heat some oil in a pan, add the chicken, garlic, ginger and vegetables. Stir, whilst cooking on a high heat, to make sure it doesn't burn.
  4. Once the chicken is cooked through, add the noodles to the pan and the soy sauce. Stir thoroughly and then serve with the cashew nuts sprinkled on top.

title: Chicken noodle soup
summary: A simple but filling soup which can be spiced up with some shredded chilli if you like a little heat!
author: Umami
ingredients: 2 chicken breasts (or use left over cooked chicken), one litre of chicken stock, one onion, 2 cloves of garlic, one celery, 100g rice noodles, 4 spring onions, 2 teaspoons of soy sauce, 1 teaspoon of ginger
recipe_instruction:
1. Chop the onion, garlic, spring onions and celery. Cut the chicken into small strips.
  2. On a medium heat, gently cook the onions and garlic and seal the chicken. Add the stock and simmer until the chicken is cooked through. When the chicken is tender, take it out the stock, shred it and return it to the stock.
  3. Add the noodles, spring onions, soy sauce and ginger to the stock and simmer gently until the noodles are cooked.
  4. Serve in small bowls and sprinkle with a pinch of spring onions or chilli is desired.

title: Scones
summary: The key item in a typically English cream tea! Don’t forget the jam and cream!
author: Umami
ingredients: 225g self-raising flour, 45g butter, 120ml milk, 25g caster sugar, a pinch of salt
recipe_instruction:
1. Preheat the oven to 220c and grease a baking tray.
  2. In a large bowl, add the salt to the flour and sieve to remove any lumps. Add the butter and rub into the flour.
  3. Add the sugar into the mix and slowly add the milk to form a dough.
  4. On a wooden board, sprinkle some flour and turn out the dough. Either roll the dough or gently pat it until it’s around 2-3cm high.
  5. Using a 5cm cookie cutter, cut out the scones and gently place on the greased tray. If you knead any left over dough and roll it out again, you can squeeze some more scones from the mix.
  6. Brush the scones with a little milk (or egg) and then bake in the preheated oven for 10-15minutes. Place the scones on a cooling rack for a minutes or so, before serving whilst still warm. Delicious!

title: Satay Chicken
summary: Chicken satay on skewers is perfect for summer barbecues or cosy nights in. Whether you like them with a little kick or without, this simple dish can be served with rice for a quick midweek meal, or with an array of other plates for a feast!
author: Umami
ingredients: 6 chicken breasts (without skin),4 tablespoons of peanut butter,1 tin of coconut milk (165ml),2 cloves of garlic,2 tablespoons of lime or lemon juice,1 teaspoon of honey,1 tablespoon of soy sauce,1 teaspoon of curry powder or chilli powder
recipe_instruction:
1. Cut the chicken breasts into 2cm strips, removing any skin or fatty bits.
  2. Combine the peanut butter, coconut milk, chopped garlic, juice, honey, soy sauce and powder.
  3. Marinade the chicken in the sauce overnight (if possible)
  4. Thread the chicken onto the skewers
  5. Barbecue or grill the chicken skewers, turning frequently, pouring the any remaining sauce over them as they cook.
